definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: He CNNs his old friends for not lending money to him.
sentences.chinese: 老朋友们因为不愿意借钱给他而遭到他无耻地辱骂。

sentences.english: Charles Muntz: Where is your elderly friend?
The frequency hit high for the first time in 1979.
sentences.chinese: 授予老朋友称号的频率在1979年达到顶峰。

sentences.english: A bit further down the street, Pam bumps into an old friend, Susie.
sentences.chinese: 潘再走了一段路后遇见老朋友苏西。

sentences.english: Oh, you could say that an old friend turned up and that you wanted to see her.
sentences.chinese: 哦，你可以说一位老朋友来了，你想跟她见见面。

sentences.english: He mistook me for his old friend whom he hadn't seen for years.
sentences.chinese: 他把我当作他多年不见的老朋友了。

sentences.english: I just want to chat with one of my old friend.
sentences.chinese: 我就是想跟我的一个老朋友聊聊天。

sentences.english: Lucia was shopping when she suddenly bumped into her old friend Debra.
sentences.chinese: 露西亚购物时碰上了老朋友黛布拉。

sentences.english: Craig was an old friend, and I had done my best to bring them together.
sentences.chinese: 克雷格是我的老朋友，我竭尽全力让他们一起合作。

sentences.english: Kaen : hello darkness, my old friend.
Among great powers, Russia is the only country where “old friends” hardly appeared.
sentences.chinese: 在大国中，俄罗斯是“老朋友”几近于无的国家。

sentences.english: That is what my old friend said with a strained voice.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我的老朋友用紧张的声音所说的话。

sentences.english: As soon as she became rich, she cast aside all her old friends.
sentences.chinese: 她一旦变富就把老朋友都撇了。

sentences.english: In the meantime, he wanted to show off his achievements to his old friend.
sentences.chinese: 同时也想在老朋友面前展示一下自己在梁国的成就。

sentences.english: On a brightly-shining Saturday afternoon, two old friends just stay at the balcony, chattering and reminiscing .
sentences.chinese: 一个阳光灿烂的周末下午，两个老朋友闲谈旧话。

definition: old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
to reminisce/to talk about former times
close friend/pal/(social networking website) friend/CL:個|个[ge4]
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
friends despite the difference in age
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
